meanings.definition: A person who believes in strict adherence to fundamental principles or doctrines.
meanings.sent1: The fundamentalist always follows the basic rules closely.
meanings.sent2: The fundamentalist attends church regularly and reads the holy book daily.
meanings.sent3: The fundamentalist joked that even their pet cat followed the house rules more strictly.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the cause made her a fundamentalist in the eyes of her peers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fundamentalist praying fervently is etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A member of a religious movement that emphasizes the literal interpretation of religious texts.
meanings.sent1: The fundamentalist group reads the scriptures word for word.
meanings.sent2: The fundamentalist community gathers to discuss the ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The fundamentalist chuckled at the thought of taking every word literally.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he was a fundamentalist, seeing only black and white in the text.
meanings.sent5: The fundamentalist's devotion to the literal meaning of the text was unwavering.
